atten3.ptxt: After turning the ignition switch off, waiting time may be required before disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal. Therefore, make sure to read the disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal notice before proceeding with work (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE LOWER NO. 3 STEERING WHEEL COVER

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver wrapped with protective tape, detach the 2 claws and remove the lower No. 3 steering wheel cover.

atten4.ptxt: Protective tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE LOWER NO. 2 STEERING WHEEL COVER

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver wrapped with protective tape, detach the 2 claws and remove the lower No. 2 steering wheel cover.

atten4.ptxt: Protective tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, loosen the 2 screws until the groove along the screw circumference catches on the screw case.
Pull out the steering pad from the steering wheel as shown in the illustration. Then support the steering pad with one hand.

atten3.ptxt: When removing the steering pad, do not pull the airbag wire harness.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector and remove the steering pad .

atten3.ptxt: When handling the airbag connector, take care not to damage the airbag wire harness.
